result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan Y Geiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ($910.69) to be paid as follows:  $700 payable to Guaranty Bank and $210.69 payable to the victim V.W. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Restitution to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs ($253) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Criminal Thinking Class.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with all Standard Release Conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 01-26-2015.

ADDRESS INFO for Logan Y Geiger
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2015)

Letter to defendant from court clerk advising him that Judge Dreyfus denied his request for a 24 hour release from custody.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
 Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Inmate Communication letter; requesting to be present at the birth of his child

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Logan Y Geiger in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   

State presented their sentence recommendations.
Defense presented their sentence recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
Concurrent to count 2.
Stayed

Term of Probation: 18 Months
Concurrent to count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint or her residence.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  $910.69 (Breakdown:  $700 to Guaranty Bank, $210.69 to Victim (V.W.) listed in Criminal Complaint - Restitution to be paid first, individual first then bank).
Costs:  $243
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200
DRGOD:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
15 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standards release conditions).
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility no later than 6:00 p.m. on:  01/26/15




Count 2:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to count 1.
Stayed

Term of Probation:   18 Months.
Concurrent to count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
DRGOD:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
